DOC.brief_summary: This study was designed to evaluate urinary function before and one year after single incision sling placement at the time of robotic sacrocolpopexy. The thought is that the more minimally-invasive, single incision sling would provide a similar subjective success rates as those of retropubic and trans-obturator slings.
DOC.brief_title: Single Incision Suburethral Sling at Time of Robotic Sacrocolpopexy
DOC.criteria: all patients undergoing single incision sling placement at the time of robotic sacrocolpopexy during the study period previous surgical treatment for stress urinary incontinence (SUI)
